My memory may be a bit biased, but I feel that most Sion ults I see are used as escapes or point-black CC. I almost never see Sions use their ult to engage in fights from a long range, and it makes me a little sad.

Just ult down mid when there's a stall going on like 2 teams just standing around the tower taking pot shot at each other. 75% someone is going to get a deer in the headlight reaction and you ram into them. The other 25% is that they are too focused on dodging you that their positioning get screwed, allowing pick off

That is because most people don't use it right. They always try to initiate a fight, and when they repeatedly fail, they say "oh, it's only good for escape." and don't engage with it anymore. Sion has kind of crappy engage because it is so unreliable against good players, but EXTRAORDINARY followup if someone else engages the fight first for him. It is still amazing to charge all the way from you inhibitor to their tier two tower and then stun lock 4 enemy champions once you arrive.

Reducing enemies to smoldering craters.
Weren't you the one complaining that he's weak? o.o You seem to still do fine as him.

He is weak; all of Veigar's previous counters are still viable in addition to the loss of reliability on his Q, the delay to his E, and the reduction of .2 AP scaling on his ult. These changes make what was once a manageable lane into a tedious one.

I, being the dedicated Veigar player that I am, work around his weaknesses, just as I did before his nerfs. Compared to now, his kill potential since 5.4 has significantly dropped, as harassing an opponent is out of the question.

22/1 kind of says otherwise, but if you're truly dedicated to the champion, then that's fine. I still find Veigar completely fine now, and think they might be overbuffing him in the wrong places now.

PS: Don't know why someone downvoted you, guess they can't explain why they don't agree with you.

Bear in mind one match is no grounds for declaring the level of success a champion can be expected to achieve. I was played well, and my team played very well, enabling me to take a lead and run with it, easily securing victory. My lane opponent was also Cassiopeia, a champion with no mobility and a passive that grants her extra AP whether she wants it or not. Also, she never built Magic Resist, and was easily deleted with each encounter.

That being said, Veigar works fine as he is now, but is by no means as powerful as he was prior to patch 5.4, a point at which even while being significantly more powerful, Veigar was considered a sub-par pick.

To whomever down-voted me, to each their own; they did not agree with my statement and acted accordingly. I cannot fault them for displaying their opinion.
